step_data.thought:
Looking at the current state of the page, I can see that I'm already in the Sales section, specifically on the Orders page. The page title shows 'Orders / Operations / Sales / Magento Admin' and there is a heading [708] that says 'Orders'. I can also see a table showing order information (though currently it shows 'We couldn't find any records'). 

The goal was to navigate to the Sales section to manage orders and transactions, and I have successfully reached that destination. The Orders page is where orders can be managed, and I can see various controls like 'Create New Order' button, filters, and export options that would allow the user to manage orders.

Since I've already accomplished the goal of navigating to the Sales section (specifically the Orders page) where orders and transactions can be managed, I should inform the user that the goal has been completed.
step_data.action: stop('You are now in the Sales section, specifically on the Orders page where you can manage orders and transactions. This page provides tools to create new orders, view existing orders, filter and search for specific orders, and perform various actions on orders.')
